body:
Could you provide a thread dump when in that state? You need to `kill -3 <zap-pid>`.

EDIT: `-3` not `-9` ...
@strunz983 had you tried to install all addons from the market place?
Some of them are not in the marketplace (e.g. `birtreports`, `soap`, `cspscanner`).

Good point. Is this a really old kali install/image?

Or did you manually grab extensions from somewhere?
Hi i just reinstall zaproxy from kali pero and i download ZAP_WEEKLY_D-2019-09-16 version and i get the same issue

how to do this 
Could you provide a thread dump when in that state? You need to kill -3 <zap-pid>.

EDIT: -3 not -9 ...
Check the PID of ZAP (e.g. using `ps` or task manager), then in a terminal run the command mentioned above. The thread dump will be displayed In the terminal where ZAP is running.

Can you open a terminal, start zap, check the process ID, do a `kill -3` on that pid, then send us the console text from the terminal you started zap in. (Yes itâ€™s a Java process....zap is a Java app ðŸ™‚)
Could you try the work around mentioned here: https://github.com/zaproxy/zaproxy/issues/5526#issuecomment-522015202

Than you kingthorin 
i disabled assistive_technologies=org.GNOME.Accessibility.AtkWrapper in /etc/java-8-openjdk/accessibility.properties file and now zaproxy is working fine 
Thank you a lot for your help :)
Reopening, it still needs to be fixed in ZAP.

issue.title: Fix deadlock when adding HTTP views

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change `HttpPanelManager` to execute the changes in the EDT to avoid
deadlock between bootstrap thread and EDT.
Remove internal synchronisation, no longer needed as the changes will be
done only in the EDT.
Add helper method to `ThreadUtils` that runs a `Runnable` in the EDT
while handling the exceptions, also, tweak/add JavaDocs.

Fix #5585 - ZAP 2.8.1 hanging on kali

issue.title: JavaFX missing

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

zaproxy can't find JavaFX on the latest Kali

**To Reproduce**

Start zaproxy

**Expected behavior**

zaproxy find JavaFX

**Software versions**
 - ZAP:  2.8.1-0kali1
 - OS:  Kali Linux rolling
 - Java: openjdk 11 /8

**Errors from the zap.log file**
```
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javafx/embed/swing/JFXPanel
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.browserView.ExtensionHttpPanelBrowserView.isJavaFxAvailable(ExtensionHttpPanelBrowserView.java:92)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.extension.browserView.ExtensionHttpPanelBrowserView.hook(ExtensionHttpPanelBrowserView.java:74)
	at org.parosproxy.paros.extension.ExtensionLoader.hookAllExtension(ExtensionLoader.java:884)
	at org.parosproxy.paros.extension.ExtensionLoader.startLifeCycle(ExtensionLoader.java:784)
	at org.parosproxy.paros.control.AbstractControl.loadExtension(AbstractControl.java:58)
	at org.parosproxy.paros.control.Control.init(Control.java:132)
	at org.parosproxy.paros.control.Control.initSingletonWithView(Control.java:345)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.GuiBootstrap.initControlAndPostViewInit(GuiBootstrap.java:270)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.GuiBootstrap.access$100(GuiBootstrap.java:68)
	at org.zaproxy.zap.GuiBootstrap$2.run(GuiBootstrap.java:208)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
	at org.zaproxy.zap.control.AddOnClassLoader.findClass(AddOnClassLoader.java:318)
	at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:588)
	at java.base/java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:521)
	... 11 more
```

**Additional context**

Installed: `libopenjfx-java`, `openjfx`, `libopenjfx-jni `, `openjdk-11`, `openjdk-8`

Tried to set `CLASSPATH` without success.

- Java-11: zaproxy can't find JavaFX
- Java-8: zaproxy freeze at startup at `[ZAP-BootstrapGUI] INFO org.parosproxy.paros.extension.ExtensionLoader  - Initializing HTTP Panel Syntax Highlighter View Extension`

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
